LogHandler Class Reference

Abstract superclass for a LogHandler that's derived to build external logging features (eg syslog, SNMP traps). More...

#include <MC2Logging.h>

    handleMessage is called with a new log entry (level and text)

Detailed Description

Abstract superclass for a LogHandler that's derived to build external logging features (eg syslog, SNMP traps).

Definition at line 126 of file MC2Logging.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void LogHandler::handleMessage (  int  level,
const char *  msg,
int  msgLen,
const char *  levelStr,
const char *  timeStamp
)  [pure virtual]
 

handleMessage is called with a new log entry (level and text)

This method should be thread safe if the LogHandler is used in a multi threaded program.

Parameters:
level The loglevel, see MC2Logging
msg Pointer to the log message
msgLen Length of the log message
levelStr String representation of the log level
timeStamp String representation of the time stamp

Implemented in SyslogLogHandler, and StreamLogHandler.
